content: Ugh — this is a great way of phrasing one of my favorite ideas with my least favorite names — the so-called “internet of things”. When I was a kid and first heard those words I was like “Star Trek! Matrix! Scott Westerfield’s Uglies/Pretties/Specials! YES!” Then I learned that it was simply “network of objects that are connected and communicate using basic programming, not even a.i.” ergo, things like Uber transitioning to self-driving cars ASAP — because safety and profit-wise, that makes the most sense. and amazon drones/delivery vans, they are cool, but also kinda creepy…why give it such a boring name as “internet of things”???? bleh imagining it as a connected network of responsive nodes — like the brain, like neural pathways — that’s a great idea. cristian — have you ever seen the tv show Scientific American Frontiers? hosted by Alan Alda? if not, check it out — i think you’ll enjoy :) thanks for this piece!
